# Sample Scene Generation Prompt

---
Use the description included with this prompt to generate a scene and save it to the samples directory with a name not found in existing samples and one that captures a short description of this scene.

## File References
- elements/arc.md
- elements/outline.md
- elements/characters.md and all referenced character files, e.g.:
  - elements/characters/paul-martinez.md
  - elements/characters/doogan-andrews.md
  - elements/characters/eddie-palmer.md
  - elements/characters/abby-palmer.md
  - elements/characters/rodney-baxter.md
  - (Optional) any matching portrait images in elements/characters/*.jpg
- elements/setting.md
- elements/theme.md
- elements/tone.md
- elements/conflict.md
- elements/plot.md
- elements/checklist.md
- elements/notes.md
- voice/format.md
- voice/style.md

## Scene Description
If the prompt does not include where the scene takes place, ask the user to be specific about the episode/installment so that the correct context can be used to generate the scene.

## Scene Charcters
If the prompt does not include which characters are in the scene, ask the user to specify which characters should be included.

## Scene Setting
If the prompt does not specify where the scene takes place, ask the user to specify the setting.

## Apply Checklist
Before writing, apply the checklist from elements/checklist.md to ensure the scene meets all required standards for quality, consistency, and style.
